level.narration1: Julie: OMG Damien are you slacking off again???
Julie: You know graph paper is for graphing things, right? This is algebra class?
Julie: Ooh you have pink crayons?! I love pink :3
level.narration2: Damien: What? No it's totally red.

level.narration1: Julie: Awww the blocks get to be friends! This is so cute!
level.narration2: Damien: â€¦"cute" isn't really the adjective I would use.
level.narration1: Julie: Oh hush, you're the one who made them pink.

level.narration2: Damien: But you'll be trapped here foreveeeeer
level.narration1: Julie: Okay jeez I hear you.
Julie: So what if I have too many blocks?
level.narration2: Damien: Well, so long as some of them cover the goal, you're fine.
level.narration1: Julie: So they can all be friends! Cute!
level.narration2: Damien: Can we at least call them "fierce allies" instead of "friends."
Damien: OMG are you slacking off again? Shouldn't you be paying attention to class?
level.narration1: Julie: Oh hush, this is all your fault anyway
Julie: Whoa, dissolving acid? Do you think we could pour that junk on Ms. Hall's hair? You know it's hideous.
Julie: Wait, so you said the way this acid works, I pour it on my arm and then I'd have my hand just floating beside me?
level.narration2: Damien: Yeah, I saw it in a comic book.
level.narration1: Julie: I can't decide if that's gross or cool.
Julie: DAMIEN. Now you're just being mean!

level.narration2: Damien: Haha are you ready to give up yet?

level.narration1: Julie: Wait, first acid, now teleportation? What's the next superpower gonna be, dragons???
level.narration2: Damien: What. "Dragons" is not a superpower.
Damien: Also I would need to upgrade from graph paper for that...
